Clostridium septicum.label: Clostridium septicum
Clostridium septicum.description:
Clostridium septicum is a gram positive, spore forming, obligate anaerobic bacterium.
Clostridium septicum can cause gas gangrene, but unlike other Clostridium species like Clostridium perfringens, no ... Wikipedia

Deltaproteobacteria.label: Deltaproteobacteria
Deltaproteobacteria.description: Deltaproteobacteria is a class of Proteobacteria. All species of this group are, like all Proteobacteria, gram-negative. Wikipedia

Alphaproteobacteria.label: Alphaproteobacteria
Alphaproteobacteria.description: Alphaproteobacteria is a class of bacteria in the phylum Proteobacteria. Its members are highly diverse and possess few commonalities, but nevertheless share a common ancestor. Wikipedia

Rickettsia.label: Rickettsia
Rickettsia.description: Rickettsia is a genus of non-motile, Gram-negative, non-sporeforming, highly pleomorphic bacteria that can present as cocci, rods or thread-like. Wikipedia

Spirillum.label: Spirillum
Spirillum.description: Spirillum in microbiology refers to a bacterium with a cell body that twists like a spiral. It is the third distinct bacterial cell shape type besides coccus and bacillus cells. Wikipedia

Treponema.label: Treponema
Treponema.description:
Treponema is a bacterial genus. The major species is Treponema pallidum, whose subspecies are responsible for diseases such as syphilis and yaws.
The species Treponema hyodysenteriae and Treponema innocens have been reclassified into Serpula. Wikipedia

Aquificae.label: Aquificae
Aquificae.description: The Aquificae phylum is a diverse collection of bacteria that live in harsh environmental settings. They have been found in hot springs, sulfur pools, and thermal ocean vents. Wikipedia

Chlamydiae.label: Chlamydiae
Chlamydiae.description: Chlamydiae is a bacterial phylum and class whose members are obligate intracellular pathogens. Many chlamydiae coexist in an asymptomatic state within specific hosts, and it is widely believed that ... Wikipedia

Clostridium.label: Clostridium
Clostridium.description: Clostridium is a genus of Gram-positive bacteria, belonging to the Firmicutes. They are obligate anaerobes capable of producing endospores. Individual cells are rod-shaped, which gives them their name, from the Greek kloster or spindle. Wikipedia

Cyanobacteria.label: Cyanobacteria
Cyanobacteria.description: Cyanobacteria, also known as Cyanophyta, is a phylum of bacteria that obtain their energy through photosynthesis. The name "cyanobacteria" comes from the color of the bacteria. Wikipedia

Deinococcus-Thermus.label: Deinococcus-Thermus
Deinococcus-Thermus.description:
The Deinococcus-Thermus are a small group of bacteria that are highly resistant to environmental hazards.
There are two main groups. Wikipedia

Escherichia coli.label: Escherichia coli
Escherichia coli.description: Escherichia coli is a Gram-negative, facultatively anaerobic, rod-shaped bacterium that is commonly found in the lower intestine of warm-blooded organisms. Wikipedia

Legionella.label: Legionella
Legionella.description: The genus Legionella is a pathogenic group of gram negative bacteria, that includes the species L. pneumophila, causing Legionellosis including a pneumonia type illness called Legionnaires Disease and a mild flu like illness called Pontiac fever. Wikipedia

Spirochaete.label: Spirochaete
Spirochaete.description: Spirochaetes belong to a phylum of distinctive diderm bacteria, most of which have long, helically coiled cells. Spirochaetes are chemoheterotrophic in nature, with lengths between 5 and 250 µm and diameters around 0.1–0.6 µm. Wikipedia

Staphylococcus aureus.label: Staphylococcus aureus
Staphylococcus aureus.description: Staphylococcus aureus is a bacterium that is a member of the Firmicutes, and is frequently found in the human respiratory tract and on the skin. Wikipedia

Frankineae.label: Frankineae
Frankineae.description: Frankineae is a suborder of the Actinomycetales order. Like all Actinobacteria, the species are gram-positive with high G+C ratio. It is polyphyletic. Wikipedia

Micromonosporaceae.label: Micromonosporaceae
Micromonosporaceae.description: Micromonosporaceae is a family of bacteria of the order Actinomycetales. They are gram-positive, spore-forming soil organisms that form a true mycelium. Wikipedia

SAR11 clade.label: SAR11 clade
SAR11 clade.description: The SAR11 clade, or Pelagibacteraceae, defines a lineage of bacteria that is extremely common in the ocean. Bacteria in the SAR11 clade make up roughly one in three cells at the ocean's surface. Wikipedia

ST8:USA300.label: ST8USA300
ST8:USA300.description: ST8USA300 is a strain of community-associated MRSA that has emerged as a particularly antibiotic resistant epidemic that is responsible for rapidly progressive, fatal diseases including necrotizing ... Wikipedia

Aquifex aeolicus.label: Aquifex aeolicus
Aquifex aeolicus.description: Aquifex aeolicus is a rod-shaped bacterium with a length of 2 to 6 micrometers and a diameter of around half a micrometer. Wikipedia

Chlamydia (genus).label: Chlamydia
Chlamydia (genus).description: Chlamydia is a genus of bacteria that are obligate intracellular parasites. Chlamydia infections are the most common bacterial sexually transmitted diseases in humans and are the leading cause of infectious blindness worldwide. Wikipedia

Gracilicutes.label: Gracilicutes
Gracilicutes.description:
Gracilicutes is a controversial taxon in bacterial taxonomy.
Traditionally gram staining results were most commonly used as a classification tool, consequently until the advent of molecular phylogeny, ... Wikipedia

Haematobacter.label: Haematobacter
Haematobacter.description: In taxonomy, Haematobacter is a genus of the Rhodobacteraceae. Wikipedia

Hyphomonadaceae.label: Hyphomonadaceae
Hyphomonadaceae.description: In taxonomy, the Hyphomonadaceae are a family of the Rhodobacterales. Wikipedia

Maritimibacter.label: Maritimibacter
Maritimibacter.description: In taxonomy, Maritimibacter is a genus of the Rhodobacteraceae. Wikipedia

Pseudorhodobacter.label: Pseudorhodobacter
Pseudorhodobacter.description: In taxonomy, Pseudorhodobacter is a genus of the Rhodobacteraceae. Wikipedia

Pseudovibrio.label: Pseudovibrio
Pseudovibrio.description: In taxonomy, Pseudovibrio is a genus of the Rhodobacteraceae. Wikipedia

Rhodothalassium.label: Rhodothalassium
Rhodothalassium.description: In taxonomy, Rhodothalassium is a genus of the Rhodobacteraceae. Wikipedia

Rickettsia conorii.label: Rickettsia conorii
Rickettsia conorii.description: Rickettsia conorii is a gram-negative, obligate intracellular bacterium of the genus Rickettsia that causes human disease called Boutonneuse fever, Mediterranean spotted fever, Israeli tick typhus, ... Wikipedia

Roseibacterium.label: Roseibacterium
Roseibacterium.description: In taxonomy, Roseibacterium is a genus of the Rhodobacteraceae. Wikipedia

Roseinatronobacter.label: Roseinatronobacter
Roseinatronobacter.description: In taxonomy, Roseinatronobacter is a genus of the Rhodobacteraceae. Wikipedia

Thalassobacter.label: Thalassobacter
Thalassobacter.description: In taxonomy, Thalassobacter is a genus of the Rhodobacteraceae. Wikipedia

Streptoalloteichus.label: Streptoalloteichus
Streptoalloteichus.description:
Streptoalloteichus is a genus of bacteria within the family Pseudonocardiaceae that contains two known species
S. hindustanus, which is known for the production of tallysomycin, an Antitumor antibiotic; ... Wikipedia

Spirillaceae.label: Spirillaceae
Spirillaceae.description:
Spirillaceae is a family of bacteria. It has been described as a member of Nitrosomonadales, in Betaproteobacteria.
It includes the species Spirillum minus which causes Rat bite fever. Wikipedia

Bacillus subtilis.label: Bacillus subtilis
Bacillus subtilis.description: Bacillus subtilis, known also as the hay bacillus or grass bacillus, is a Gram-positive, catalase-positive bacterium. Wikipedia

Enterobacteriaceae.label: Enterobacteriaceae
Enterobacteriaceae.description: The Enterobacteriaceae is a large family of Gram-negative bacteria that includes, along with many harmless symbionts, many of the more familiar pathogens, such as Salmonella, Escherichia coli, Yersinia pestis, Klebsiella and Shigella. Wikipedia

Epsilonproteobacteria.label: Epsilonproteobacteria
Epsilonproteobacteria.description: Epsilonproteobacteria is a class of Proteobacteria. All species of this class are, like all Proteobacteria, Gram-negative. Wikipedia

Gammaproteobacteria.label: Gammaprotoebacteria
Gammaproteobacteria.description: Gammaproteobacteria is a class of several medically, ecologically and scientifically important groups of bacteria, such as the Enterobacteriaceae, Vibrionaceae and Pseudomonadaceae. Wikipedia

Actinobacteria.label: Actinobacteria
Actinobacteria.description: Actinobacteria are a group of Gram-positive bacteria. They were all believed to have high guanine and cytosine content in their DNA. However, recently it has been shown that several freshwater Actinobacteria actually have low G+C content. Wikipedia

Azotobacter.label: Azotobacter
Azotobacter.description: Azotobacter is a genus of usually motile, oval or spherical bacteria that form thick-walled cysts and may produce large quantities of capsular slime. Wikipedia

Bacillus.label: Bacillus
Bacillus.description: Bacillus is a genus of Gram-positive, rod-shaped, bacteria and a member of the phylum Firmicutes. Bacillus species can be obligate aerobes, or facultative anaerobes. Wikipedia

Bacillus anthracis.label: Bacillus anthracis
Bacillus anthracis.description: Bacillus anthracis is the etiologic agent of anthrax — a common disease of livestock and, occasionally, of humans — and the only obligate pathogen within the genus Bacillus. Wikipedia

Bacteria.label: Bacteria
Bacteria.description: Bacteria constitute a large domain of prokaryotic microorganisms. Typically a few micrometres in length, bacteria have a number of shapes, ranging from spheres to rods and spirals. Wikipedia

Bacteroidetes.label: Bacteroidetes
Bacteroidetes.description: The phylum Bacteroidetes is composed of three large classes of Gram-negative, nonsporeforming, anaerobic, and rod-shaped bacteria that are widely distributed in the environment, including in soil, ... Wikipedia

Chlamydiaceae.label: Chlamydiaceae
Chlamydiaceae.description: Chlamydiaceae is a family of bacteria that belongs to the Phylum Chlamydiae, Order Chlamydiales. All Chlamydiaceae species are Gram-negative and express the family-specific lipopolysaccharide epitope αKdo--αKdo--αKdo. Wikipedia

Chloroflexi (class).label: Chloroflexi
Chloroflexi (class).description: Chloroflexi is one of six classes of bacteria in the phylum Chloroflexi, known as filamentous green non-sulfur bacteria. They produce energy from light and are named for their green pigment, usually found in photosynthetic bodies called chlorosomes. Wikipedia

Clostridium botulinum.label: Clostridium botulinum
Clostridium botulinum.description: Clostridium botulinum is a Gram-positive, rod-shaped bacterium that produces several exotoxins. The best known are its neurotoxins, subdivided in types A-H, that cause the flaccid muscular paralysis seen in botulism. Wikipedia

Dictyoglomus thermophilum.label: Dictyoglomus thermophilum
Dictyoglomus thermophilum.description: Dictyoglomus is a genus of bacterium, given its own phylum, called the Dictyoglomi. This organism is extremely thermophilic, meaning it thrives at extremely high temperatures. Wikipedia

Planctomycetes.label: Planctomycetes
Planctomycetes.description: Planctomycetes are a phylum of aquatic bacteria and are found in samples of brackish, and marine and fresh water. They reproduce by budding. Wikipedia

Proteobacteria.label: Proteobacteria
Proteobacteria.description: The Proteobacteria are a major group of bacteria. They include a wide variety of pathogens, such as Escherichia, Salmonella, Vibrio, Helicobacter, and many other notable genera. Wikipedia

Rhodobacter.label: Rhodobacter
Rhodobacter.description: In taxonomy, Rhodobacter is a genus of the Rhodobacteraceae. The most famous species of Rhodobacter is Rhodobacter sphaeroides, which is commonly used to express proteins. Wikipedia

Streptobacillus.label: Streptobacillus
Streptobacillus.description:
Streptobacillus is a genus of aerobic, gram-negative facultative anaerobe bacteria, which grow in culture as rods in chains.
Species associated with infection - S. moniliformis
Reported susceptibilities and therapies - penicillin, erythromycin Wikipedia

Streptococcus pneumoniae.label: Streptococcus pneumoniae
Streptococcus pneumoniae.description: Streptococcus pneumoniae, or pneumococcus, is a Gram-positive, alpha-hemolytic, aerotolerant, aerobic member of the genus Streptococcus. Wikipedia

Thermotogae.label: Thermotogae
Thermotogae.description: Thermotogae is a phylum of the domain "Bacteria". Wikipedia

Thermus aquaticus.label: Thermus aquaticus
Thermus aquaticus.description: Thermus aquaticus is a species of bacterium that can tolerate high temperatures, one of several thermophilic bacteria that belong to the Deinococcus-Thermus group. It is very small, having an average size of 15 nm. Wikipedia

Verrucomicrobia.label: Verrucomicrobia
Verrucomicrobia.description: Verrucomicrobia is a recently described phylum of bacteria. This phylum contains only a few described species. The species identified have been isolated from fresh water and soil environments and human faeces. Wikipedia

Streptococcus oralis.label: Streptococcus oralis
Streptococcus oralis.description: Streptococcus oralis is a Gram positive bacterium that grows characteristically in chains. It forms small white colonies on a Wilkins-Chalgren agar plate. It is found in high numbers in the oral cavity. Wikipedia

Actinomyces.label: Actinomyces
Actinomyces.description: Actinomyces is a genus of the actinobacteria class of bacteria. They are all Gram-positive. Actinomyces are facultatively anaerobic. All species grow best under anaerobic conditions. Wikipedia

Actinomyces israelii.label: ''Actinomyces israelii''
Actinomyces israelii.description: Actinomyces israelii is a species of gram-positive rod-shaped bacteria within the Actinomyces. Known to live commensally on and within humans, A. israelii is an opportunistic pathogen and a cause of actinomycosis. Wikipedia

Aeromonas punctata.label: Aeromonas punctata
Aeromonas punctata.description: Aeromonas punctata is a synonym of Aeromonas caviae. The bacterium is found in sewage, fresh water and in animals. Wikipedia

Amycolatopsis.label: Amycolatopsis
Amycolatopsis.description: Amycolatopsis is a genus of high GC-content bacteria within the family Pseudonocardiaceae. These produce Epoxyquinomicin C, a weak antibiotic and anti-inflammatory agent. Wikipedia

Borrelia.label: Borrelia
Borrelia.description: Borrelia is a genus of bacteria of the spirochete phylum. It causes borreliosis, a zoonotic, vector-borne disease transmitted primarily by ticks and some by lice, depending on the species. There are 36 known species of Borrelia. Wikipedia

Haemophilus influenzae.label: Haemophilus influenzae
Haemophilus influenzae.description: Haemophilus influenzae is a Gram-negative, coccobacillary, facultatively anaerobic bacterium belonging to the Pasteurellaceae family. H. influenzae was first described in 1892 by Richard Pfeiffer during an influenza pandemic. Wikipedia

Streptomyces coelicolor.label: Streptomyces coelicolor
Streptomyces coelicolor.description: Streptomyces coelicolor is a soil-dwelling Gram-positive bacterium that belongs to the genus Streptomyces. Wikipedia

Venenivibrio stagnispumantis.label: Venenivibrio stagnispumantis
Venenivibrio stagnispumantis.description: Venenivibrio stagnispumantis strain CP.B2 is the first microorganisms isolated from the terrestrial hot spring Champagne Pool in Waiotapu, New Zealand. Wikipedia

Herpetosiphon.label: Herpetosiphon
Herpetosiphon.description: Herpetosiphon is a genus of bacteria in the family Herpetosiphonaceae. Wikipedia

Herpetosiphon giganteus.label: Herpetosiphon giganteus
Herpetosiphon giganteus.description:
Herpetosiphon giganteus is a species of bacteria in the genus Herpetosiphon known to produce 16 restriction enzymes.
H. giganteus has been studied for its gliding motility. Wikipedia

Sporosarcina pasteurii.label: Sporosarcina pasteurii
Sporosarcina pasteurii.description: Sporosarcina pasteurii formerly known as Bacillus pasteurii from older taxonomies, is a bacterium with the ability to precipitate calcite and solidify sand given a calcium source and urea, through the ... Wikipedia

Abiotrophia.label: Abiotrophia
Abiotrophia.description: Abiotrophia is a genus of lactic acid bacteria, a family in the phylum Firmicutes. Wikipedia

Ahrensia.label: Ahrensia
Ahrensia.description: In taxonomy, Ahrensia is a genus of the Rhodobacteraceae. Ahrensia is named after the German microbiologist R. Ahrens. The cells are rod-shaped and motile. They are strictly aerobic. Wikipedia

Albidovulum.label: Albidovulum
Albidovulum.description: In taxonomy, Albidovulum is a genus of the Rhodobacteraceae. Wikipedia

Alteromonas.label: Alteromonas
Alteromonas.description: Alteromonas is a genus of Proteobacteria found in sea water, either in the open ocean or in the coast. It is gram-negative. Its cells are curved rods with a single polar flagellum. Wikipedia

Amaricoccus.label: Amaricoccus
Amaricoccus.description: In taxonomy, Amaricoccus is a genus of the Rhodobacteraceae. Wikipedia

Faecalibacterium prausnitzii.label: Faecalibacterium prausnitzii
Faecalibacterium prausnitzii.description: Faecalibacterium prausnitzii is a commensal bacterium of the human gut flora. Recent medical research has suggested that low levels of F. prausnitzii may be associated with Crohn's Disease. Wikipedia

Ketogulonicigenium.label: Ketogulonicigenium
Ketogulonicigenium.description: In taxonomy, Ketogulonicigenium is a genus of the Rhodobacteraceae. Wikipedia

Maribius.label: Maribius
Maribius.description: In taxonomy, Maribius is a genus of the Rhodobacteraceae. Wikipedia

Marinosulfonomonas.label: Marinosulfonomonas
Marinosulfonomonas.description: In taxonomy, Marinosulfonomonas is a genus of the Rhodobacteraceae. Wikipedia

Pannonibacter.label: Pannonibacter
Pannonibacter.description: In taxonomy, Pannonibacter is a genus of the Rhodobacteraceae. Wikipedia

Silicibacter.label: Silicibacter
Silicibacter.description: In taxonomy, Silicibacter is a genus of the Rhodobacteraceae. Wikipedia

Spirochaeta americana.label: Spirochaeta americana
Spirochaeta americana.description: Spirochaeta americana is a relatively newly discovered single-celled extremophile. This haloalkaliphilic and obligately anaerobic bacterium can be found in the bleach-like highly alkaline, salty, deep waters of California's Mono Lake. Wikipedia

Staleya.label: Staleya
Staleya.description:
In taxonomy, Staleya is a genus of the Rhodobacteraceae.
This genus is named in honor of the American microbiologist J.T. Staley for his work on budding bacteria. Wikipedia

Stappia.label: Stappia
Stappia.description: In taxonomy, Stappia is a genus of the Rhodobacteraceae. Some members of the genus oxidize carbon monoxide aerobically. Wikipedia

Thalassobius.label: Thalassobius
Thalassobius.description: In taxonomy, Thalassobius is a genus of the Rhodobacteraceae. Wikipedia

Acidobacteria.label: Acidobacteria
Acidobacteria.description: Acidobacteria are a newly devised phylum of Bacteria, whose members are physiologically diverse and ubiquitous, especially in soils, but are under-represented in culture. Wikipedia

Firmicutes.label: Firmicutes
Firmicutes.description: The Firmicutes are a phylum of bacteria, most of which have Gram-positive cell wall structure. A few, however, such as Megasphaera, Pectinatus, Selenomonas and Zymophilus, have a porous pseudo-outer-membrane that causes them to stain Gram-negative. Wikipedia

Green sulfur bacteria.label: Green sulfur bacteria
Green sulfur bacteria.description: The green sulfur bacteria are a family of obligately anaerobic photoautotrophic bacteria. Most closely related to the distant Bacteroidetes, they are accordingly assigned their own phylum. Wikipedia

Pseudomonas.label: Pseudomonas
Pseudomonas.description: Pseudomonas is a genus of Gram-negative aerobic gammaproteobacteria, belonging to the family Pseudomonadaceae containing 191 validly described species. Wikipedia

Tenericutes.label: Tenericutes
Tenericutes.description: Tenericutes is a phylum of bacteria that contains the Class Mollicutes. The name was validated in 1984 as a new division. The Tenericutes lack a cell wall and therefore are Gram negative. Wikipedia
